template.template_info_text: Your configuration template is active, to modify it
template.template_info_text_case2: A configuration template was found but it is not active, to activate it
template.template_info_text_case3: No configuration template found, to create one
template.information_text: The information from this configuration template is saved in your browser's Localstorage resource. If deleted, your model parameters will no longer be written automatically.
template.collapseOne_text: This step is intended for the general configuration of the created tenant, it mainly applies to SIP settings.
template.collapseWebrtc_text: This step is intended for the WebRTC configuration of the created tenant.
template.collapseTwo_btn: Configuration for Wazo Web and Desktop
template.collapseTwo_text: This step is intended for customizing the STUN server for Wazo Web and Desktop applications, this step is strongly recommended.
template.collapseThree_text: This step is intended for customizing the TURN server for Wazo Mobile applications; the configuration of a TURN parameter is mandatory for clients using them.

step0.subtitle_text: This tool assists you step by step in the overall settings of your customer tenant:
step0.step0_panel2_apps_tippy: Active application configurations are replaced by the Wizard

step1.subtitle_text: At this step, choose the global parameters to assign to the site:
step1.step1_panel1_title_tippy: Language selection so that the system can play audio files in the given language automatically.
step1.step1_panel2_title_tippy: Choosing the codecs to use, we recommend that you activate a minimum codec (corresponding to your trunk operator) in order to limit negotiation. Please note, it is not possible to choose the prioritization order immediately.
step1.step1_panel3_title_tippy: The music on hold listed are those created in the site in question, this option allows you to add default music on hold for the entire site.
step1.step1_panel4_title_tippy: This option allows the activation of the parameters necessary for the use of telephone sets behind a NAT environment.

step2.subtitle_text: At this step, choose the settings intended for Wazo applications for
step2.step2_panel1_title_tippy: Choosing the codecs to use, we recommend that you activate a minimum codec (corresponding to your trunk operator) in order to limit negotiation. Please note, it is not possible to choose the prioritization order immediately.

step3.subtitle_text: Check and save your settings for
step3.step3_panel3_text2: You can check the applied settings from the "Settings > SIP Templates" menu.

error.warning_text_domain: The domain entered appears to be incorrect.
